The LPL's Carman Community Room will be set up as a community resource and comfortable gathering place for homeschooling families and those considering the challenge from 10 a.m. to 1 p.m. Saturday, May 20.
'Homeschool Open House' will put the spotlight on educational opportunities and enrichment activities available in the community.
Homeschool Librarian Deanna McGregor has invited representatives from homeschool extracurricular providers in sports, choir, drama, co-ops and more.
There will also be displays of library resources, a free curriculum swap and STEAM activities for the kids.
– Communications Specialist Mark Bialczak
#librariesofinstagram #libraries #publiclibraries #liverpool #liverpoolny #homeschoolopenhouse #homeschooling #homeschoolers

May 14th-20th May is Dementia Awareness Week - you can find informative and helpful displays in all of the Northamptonshire libraries! This display is at Northamptonshire Central Library and also has lots of brilliant books to support those with dementia and their carers. Check out our Facebook pages and Event Calendar for more details of what libraries are offering this week! #dementiaawarenessweek #dementia #DAW2017 #library #libraries #publiclibaries #wellbeing #northampton #northamptonshire #health #knowledge

Open house tomorrow! Come check out this beauty and many other priceless treasures! 
#Repost @fisherlibrary
・・・
The Roman de la Rose is a medieval French poem styled as an allegorical dream vision. The work’s stated purpose is to both entertain and to teach others about the ‘art of Love’. At various times in the poem, the "Rose" of the title is seen as the name of the lady, and as a symbol of female sexuality in general. This great epic poem of courtly love is the oldest complete vernacular manuscript in the Fisher collection.
.
Join us this Thursday, May 18 (12-6) to see on display recent acquisitions of the Thomas Fisher Rare Book Library, and staff will be in attendance to discuss these additions to our collections. This event is on a drop-in basis, and you are welcome to join us for a quick look or a longer visit to view some of our newest treasures.
.
Guillaume de Lorris (active 1230). Roman de la rose. [Paris?, approximately 1375?].
.
#medievalmanuscripts #rarebooks #TOevents #FisherLibrary @UofT @UofTlibraries #librariesoftheworld #librariesofinstagram #uoft #uoftbulletin #TorontoDOTac #Toronto #rarebooks #frenchliterature #libraries #library #exploreuoft #discoveruoft

2017 AIA/@americanlibraryassociation Library Building Awards: @nypl Stapleton Branch Renovation and Expansion in New York, New York. Architect: Andrew Berman Architect PLLC. Photo: Naho Kubota. 
Expanding from a single-room Carnegie branch library that had served Stapleton, Staten Island, for a century, this project has created a new 12,000-square-foot library that better serves the community. Open, inviting, and accessible, the project stitches together new and old buildings, and provides equal space for tactile and digital learning opportunities.

Voters in the Liverpool Central School District passed the 2017-2018 Liverpool Public Library budget Tuesday, May 16, by a count of 1,086 to 271.
Dorianne Gutierrez, Yvette Hewitt and Mary Schapley were elected to five-year terms to the LPL Board of Trustees.
Thanks to all who voted.
– Communications Specialist Mark Bialczak
#librariesofinstagram #libraries #publiclibraries #liverpool #liverpoolny #budgets #boardoftrustees

Hoy 17 de mayo se celebra El Día Internacional contra la Homofobia, la Transfobia y la Bifobia para conmemorar la eliminación de la homosexualidad de la lista de enfermedades mentales por parte de la Asamblea General de la Organización Mundial de la Salud (OMS), lo que tuvo lugar el 17 de mayo de 1990. Su objetivo principal es el de coordinar todo tipo de acciones que sirvan para denunciar la discriminación de que son objeto las personas homosexuales, lesbianas, bisexuales y transexuales y para hacer avanzar sus derechos en todo el mundo. 
Forma parte de la esencia de las bibliotecas públicas ser espacios disponibles para todo el mundo y así lo expresa la definición elaborada por IFLA/UNESCO 👉la Biblioteca Pública "está a disposición de todos los miembros de la comunidad por igual, sean cuales fueren su raza, nacionalidad, edad, sexo, religión, idioma, discapacidad, condición económica, laboral y nivel de instrucción".
Añadiríamos la necesidad de apoyar con nuestros fondos, actos, actividades... para hacer avanzar en los derechos de todos los colectivos discriminados 🌈 📚📚📚#homofobia #diainternacionalcontralahomofobia #transfobia #bifobia #bibliotecas #libraries #biblioteca #library

A true-to-life woodcut portrait from the title page of 'An exact description of Prince Ruperts malignant she-monkey,' London, 1643. This English Civil War pamphlet offers some unsavory satirical criticism of the Prince, to say the least. #woodcutwednesday #monkey #englishcivilwar #pamphlet #woodcut #animalsinart #specialcollections #librariesofinstagram #libraries #rarebooks #msu

It's a #tinytuesday treat! When I saw this manuscript last semester during teaching, this folio made me do a double take, and I can't believe I'm only just sharing it with you now! The beauty of this folio (and this MS, let's be honest) is breathtaking, but it was one tiny detail that made me stop and look closer. Can you spot it? Painted very finely within this Eucharistic Host is an outline of the crucifixion. This MS is one we've met before (think bathing kings and singing monks!): it's @uofglasgowasc MS Gen 288, f.38v [Bruges: c.1450-1460] which depicts the Host in a golden ciborium, with an angel holding a lighted taper to either side. This #tinytuesday detail becomes even more staggering the further you swipe through the images - the last shows my thumb, for scale! #bookofhours #eucharist #sacrament #illumination #angels #ciborium #gold #illuminatedmanuscript #goldleaf #manuscriptsofinstagram #rarebooksofinstagram  #uofglasgow #uofglibrary #iglibraries #specialcollections #archives #archivesofinstagram #libraries #librariesofinstagram #bookstagram #manuscripts #books #bookhistory #bookart #medieval #medievalmanuscripts #rarebooks #explorearchives #archivesunlocked

Our student Megann tells us this might be  #veganproblems. Charles Jameson Grant's Singular Effects of the Universal Vegetable Pills...(1841?) pokes fun at patent medicines and the purported cures they offered. Part of our larger print collection open for study.

Hey, map lovers! I’m Erin, Gallery Attendant @bplmaps, and this Wednesday’s #WordoftheWeek is for all the kids that like to color inside the lines. A “neatline” is the outermost line that frames a #map, separating it from the rest of the page. Neatlines can be elaborately decorated borders or simple black lines.  Usually all of the cartographic details are bound within the neatline, but not always. Check out how parts of Africa break through the lovely green neatline in Robert Wilkerson’s map “Africa, including the Mediterranean.” --
Robert Wilkerson, “Africa, including the Mediterranean” http://www.leventhalmap.org/id/14643
--
#neatline #Africa #cartography #19thCentury #geography #cartography #history #library #libraries #librariesofinstagram #BPLMaps #BostonPublicLIbrary
